1.text: My son, attend unto my wisdom; Incline thine ear to my understanding;

2.text: That thou mayest preserve discretion, And that thy lips may keep knowledge.

3.text: For the lips of a strange woman drop honey, And her mouth is smoother than oil;

4.text: But her end is bitter as wormwood, Sharp as a two-edged sword.

5.text: Her feet go down to death; Her steps take hold on the nether-world;

6.text: Lest she should walk the even path of life, Her ways wander, but she knoweth it not.

7.text: Now therefore, O ye children, hearken unto me, And depart not from the words of my mouth.

8.text: Remove thy way far from her, And come not nigh the door of her house;

9.text: Lest thou give thy vigour unto others, And thy years unto the cruel;

10.text: Lest strangers be filled with thy strength, And thy labours be in the house of an alien;

11.text: And thou moan, when thine end cometh, When thy flesh and thy body are consumed,

12.text: And say: ‘How have I hated instruction, And my heart despised reproof;

13.text: Neither have I hearkened to the voice of my teachers, Nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!

14.text: I was well nigh in all evil In the midst of the congregation and assembly.’

15.text: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, And running waters out of thine own well.

16.text: Let thy springs be dispersed abroad, And courses of water in the streets.

17.text: Let them be only thine own, And not strangers’ with thee.

18.text: Let thy fountain be blessed; And have joy of the wife of thy youth.

19.text: A lovely hind and a graceful doe, Let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; With her love be thou ravished always.

20.text: Why then wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, And embrace the bosom of an alien?

21.text: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, And He maketh even all his paths.

22.text: His own iniquities shall ensnare the wicked, And he shall be holden with the cords of his sin.

23.text: He shall die for lack of instruction; And in the greatness of his folly he shall reel.
